name: places/ChIJsaQ3AJhYwokRQ4kUuLG9mY8
formattedAddress: 5 East 86th St, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 5 East 86th St, New York, NY 10028-0536, USA

originalText.text:
Not a great experience to say the least. Horrible bedside manner.

First appointment went well. I had blood drawn and, based on family history, was given a prescription for a cardiac calcium score test. I was told that at my second appointment we would go over the lab results as well as the results of the cardiac scan.

I decided not to go ahead with the scan as I  felt that him and I should first go over the blood work and discuss risk v benefit of the cardiac scan (high levels of radiation that might not have been necessary depending on blood work).

At my second visit, I explained that I decided to forgo the scan and that I would like to go over the blood work first. He made it very clear that he was offended and asked "who is the doctor?" I assumed he was asking who I know in the medical field that advised me not to have the scan, so I responded, "I have friends and family who I reached out to... but I would like to discuss the labs and risk v benefit." He quickly clarified that what he meant was "are YOU a doctor?" and then proceeded to scrutinize me for "trying to take my health into my own hands."

His defensive tone was wildly unprofessional and I let him know that I was extremely uncomfortable. I asked if he would discuss the labs, to which he suggested I have my friend go over it with me. I got a copy of the results from the woman at the front desk (friendly and professional both visits) and I left.

I do not recommend Dr. Mizrahi.

originalText.text:
When reviewing a medical office, I think it’s important to have some background on the reviewer. I work in the medical field, and my top priority is excellence in clinical care. Wait times, friendly staff, spotless floors—I’m not discounting these as relevant factors, but they are not what ultimately counts for me.

Dr. Mizrahi has been my physician for the past year, and I can say with absolute certainty—I have never received such attentive and thoughtful care since being treated by my pediatrician. The time he takes with each visit is far above average, and the details in his questions are insightful without feeling intrusive. There are some who might feel the labs and diagnostics he orders are unnecessary; trust me when I say, you don’t want to be the patient where something was missed. In my case, I was caught early, and I couldn’t be more grateful.

And for those who care, the office is clean and well-designed, I sometimes feel like I’m in an old-time apothecary. The wait times are what I would consider average, although I don’t consider a 15-20 minute wait unusual. I know it can be hard to find the time and every minute in the day counts. Make the time, it’s worth it.

originalText.text:
Excellent Doctor, Dr. Mizrahi has always treated me with excellent care. Dr. Mizrahi is my primary physician for the past 30 plus years and he treats me the same professional physician.
Dr. Mizrahi's staff is a Very professional staff,  very helpful.
I would recommend Dr.Mizrahi in a heartbeat to anyone.

originalText.text: Dr. Mizrahi been my PCP since I first moved to NYC  a long while ago.  He’s extremely attentive, truly cares about his patients, and is prescriptive and diligent - all in all, what you want in a doctor. Though not the most convenient location for me, I still make the trek up to the UES because he’s the best!

originalText.text: Very good doctor but he  needs to change or train better  his staff/receptionist . They are not friendly at all and they give wrong info on the phone and make him look like he doesn’t care about his patients.
